meanings.definition: Lacking in the basic resources or conditions believed to be necessary for an equal position in society.
meanings.sent1: The disadvantaged students struggled to afford school supplies.
meanings.sent2: She felt disadvantaged compared to her wealthier classmates.
meanings.sent3: The disadvantaged puppy couldn't reach its toy on the high shelf.
meanings.sent4: The disadvantaged team fought hard despite their limited resources.
meanings.sent5: Growing up in a disadvantaged neighborhood, he learned to appreciate the value of hard work.

meanings.definition: Placed in a situation of being at a disadvantage or having less than others.
meanings.sent1: The disadvantaged team started the game with a score deficit.
meanings.sent2: Being disadvantaged in height, he had to work harder in basketball.
meanings.sent3: The disadvantaged squirrel had to compete for fewer nuts in the park.
meanings.sent4: She felt disadvantaged in the race, but her determination pushed her forward.
meanings.sent5: The disadvantaged plant struggled to grow in the shaded corner of the garden.
